intro: Henckelia dibangensis, commonly known as the Dibang henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
